title: Quick and Easy Refried Beans Recipe
description: These refried beans are made with pinto beans, garlic, spices, and lime in just 20 minutes. A perfect recipe for Taco Tuesdays or any weeknight!

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Side Dish Beans and Peas Refried Bean Recipes Quick and Easy Refried Beans 4.6 (367) 298 Reviews 31 Photos These refried beans are perfect if you don't like the canned ones and you're short on time. They're easy and delicious! Submitted by MarasFlourpower Updated on November 13, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 31 31 31 31 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 10 mins Total Time: 20 mins Servings: 6 Jump to Nutrition Facts Jump to recipe These shortcut refried beans are easy to make and even easier to eat.  How to Make Refried Beans You'll find a detailed ingredient list and step-by-step instructions in the recipe below, but let's go over the basics: What Are Refried Beans? Though the name “refried beans” implies the beans are fried twice, they’re actually only fried once. Traditionally, pinto beans are cooked and mashed, then fried on the stove until thick. This recipe starts with canned beans, which cuts the cooking time considerably. How to Season Refried Beans These homemade refried beans are flavored with fresh garlic, ground cumin, ground chili powder, salt, and fresh lime juice.  How Do You Make Refried Beans?  Here’s a brief overview of what you can expect when you make refried beans at home:  Cook the garlic in a skillet.Stir in the beans and seasonings. Smash the beans with a potato masher, then squeeze lime juice over the beans and stir. How to Store Refried Beans Store the refried beans in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to four days. Reheat gently in the microwave or on the stove.  Can You Freeze Refried Beans? Sure! You can freeze refried beans for up to three months. Freeze them in serving-sized portions in zip-top bags or another freezer-safe container. Thaw in the refrigerator overnight.  Allrecipes Community Tips and Praise  “This is an amazing recipe,” according to Miz Bonnie. “The best refried beans EVER! So easy and fast and tastes just as good as the ones made from dried beans. It’s now my very favorite refried bean recipe!” “I love how quick and easy this recipe is,” says Nic. “Great to throw together at the last minute or when you don't feel like cooking. I added some onion but pretty much stuck with the recipe. Good stuff.” “I absolutely love this recipe,” raves Courtney J. “Super fast and convenient. And it tastes amazing. I'm never going back!” Editorial contributions by Corey Williams Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 6 servings 2 tablespoons canola oil 2 garlic cloves, peeled 2 (15 ounce) cans pinto beans 1 teaspoon cumin 1 teaspoon chili powder salt to taste ½ lime, juiced Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Heat canola oil in a heavy skillet over medium heat. Cook garlic cloves in hot oil, turning once, until brown on both sides, 4 to 5 minutes. Smash garlic cloves in the skillet with a fork. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Stir pinto beans, cumin, chili powder, and salt into mashed garlic and cook until beans are thoroughly heated, about 5 minutes. Stir occasionally. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Smash bean mixture with a potato masher to desired texture. Squeeze lime juice over smashed beans and stir until combined. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Enjoy! Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 885 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Quick and Easy Refried Beans 01 of 31 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 31 Photo by  TxCin2 10/28/2024 A keeper! Fantastic and easy. This was much better than canned refried beans. I used vegetable oil, and lard would have been better, but I didn't have any. The garlic gave this a nice flavor and it didn't taste garlicky, even though I used the full amount of garlic. My cloves were small, so I used 3 little toes of garlic. I cut this in half and used 1 can of beans, and scaled back everything accordingly except that garlic. This only made two servings, but they were generous, so I could have stretched it further. I forgot to add the lime juice, but we loved them anyway, so it didn't matter. I didn't drain the beans so I just simmered them longer until they got to the consistency I wanted. No potato masher needed, I used my wooden spoon and smashed them against the sides and bottom of the skillet until I got the texture I was looking for. 03 of 31 Photo by  Rachel Galey 03/13/2024 A keeper! Great flavors Easy to follow Worth the effort Family favorite Huge hit for tonight’s supper. Along with Spanish rice and Chicken Enchiladas. What’s in the picture is what’s left. My China bowl was full. 04 of 31 Photo by  tcwashing 07/18/2023 I literally just found this recipe, prepared it and it's delicious. If my grandmother were alive, she'd be very proud. 05 of 31 Photo by  Kimberley Nelson 11/23/2021 06 of 31 Photo by  KaEllin Brown 01/04/2020 07 of 31 Photo by  Lori 12/20/2019 08 of 31 Photo by  Vika Thayer 12/08/2019 09 of 31 Photo by  LITTLEAMAZON 09/29/2019 I made these beans and they were great! I made half the recipe and used 1 teaspoon minced garlic, sautéing lightly, for like 1 minute. I didn’t drain the beans, I just dumped them by themselves with 1/2 teaspoon each of salt, cumin and chili powder. They are very flavorful and perfect for my family members because it is not spicy. 5 minutes was enough to meld all flavors. They mashed beautifully and thickened in their own. I won’t be buying refried beans anymore. 10 of 31 Photo by  Erin Goff 08/12/2019 Tasted amazing. Better than most of the restaurants I have been to. Will never buy canned refried beans again. 1 2 3 4 Next You’ll Also Love Refried Beans Without the Refry 2,604 Ratings Fat-Free Refried Beans 124 Ratings Vegetarian Refried Beans 151 Ratings Instant Pot Refried Beans 24 Ratings Mustard Greens 'n Beans 33 Ratings Mexican Bean Salad 2,786 Ratings Vegan Bean Taco Filling 434 Ratings Easy Black Beans and Tomatoes 15 Ratings Mexican Pasta 333 Ratings Vegan Tofu Tacos 3 Ratings Vegan Refried Beans 16 Ratings Southwestern Corn and Black Bean Skillet 4 Ratings Vegan Black Bean Quesadillas 91 Ratings Mexican-Style Pinto Beans 7 Ratings Vegan Fajitas 159 Ratings Sweet Potato Tacos 10 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
